---
category: news
title: "Microscopy deep learning predicts viral infections"
excerpt: "When viruses infect cells, changes in the cell nucleus occur, and these can be observed through fluorescence microscopy. Using fluorescence images from live cells, researchers have trained an artificial neural network to reliably recognize cells that are infected by adenoviruses or herpes viruses."
publishedDateTime: 2021-06-21T22:42:00Z
originalUrl: "https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2021/06/210621123733.htm"
